main event: Two civilians observed an unidentified shiny object that moved rapidly from horizon to horizon in Fresno, California on August 29, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed to rise vertically at a rapid rate of speed until it disappeared from view.
The observer was a 32-year-old civilian male who worked as a public school teacher and was an amateur astronomer.
The sighting occurred around 7:35 pm on September 14, 1952 under clear sky conditions with scattered high cirrus clouds.
There was a considerable amount of air traffic in the area at the time of the sighting, which may have contributed to the object's identification.
The report was classified as insufficient for full identification due to lack of physical evidence and the presence of nearby air traffic.
